intro: Calycadenia ramulosa, commonly known as the slender globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes mallows and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems, lobed leaves, and showy yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Calycadenia ramulosa is an important species for pollinators and is often found in chaparral and sagebrush ecosystems.
